comments.text:
See https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=autoland&group_state=expanded&resultStatus=success%2Ctestfailed%2Cbusted%2Cexception%2Csuperseded%2Cretry%2Cusercancel&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=f5c3f3004aec76887902d967f4f8eb96e1fd13ef&tochange=d920b65e3cfaecc730b79c8a96342da5f1d6fb50&fromchange=98d1b98c71776984e1209b452aa986d3e8d49a09&selectedJob=297964996 and click the "Failure Summary" tab. Very often, the log is too big to parse (actually, it might only get parsed if there is a failure during the execution and not the whole set of commands gets executed).

Due to that perfherder data is not available for these tasks.

This started after bug 1628982 landed.
comments.creator: aryx.bugmail@gmx-topmail.de
comments.author: aryx.bugmail@gmx-topmail.de

Due to that perfherder data is not available for these tasks.

This started after bug 1628982 landed.
browsertime tp6-1 and tp6-c-1 tasks fail for a different reason which should be mentioned in the log (intermittent on Windows 10, else it looks permanent).
comments.author: aryx.bugmail@gmx-topmail.de

comments.text: browsertime tp6-1 and tp6-c-1 tasks fail for a different reason which should be mentioned in the log (intermittent on Windows 10, else it looks permanent).

comments.creator: tarek@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 9141627
Bug 1631354 - very frequent browsertime speedometer logs too big to parse

Browsertime's -vvv displays the gecko profile passed through HTTP
in the logs, making them very big. This patch makes verbose output
an option and deactivates it by default.
comments.raw_text:
Browsertime's -vvv displays the gecko profile passed through HTTP
in the logs, making them very big. This patch makes verbose output
an option and deactivates it by default.
